intro: Leptoloma barbipulvinata, commonly known as the barbed pulvinate lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree bark or rock surfaces. Its unique barbed structures on the lobes are a distinguishing feature of this species.
